fields.Name: Skip AssociationDB - Hierarchical Treemap with Color-Coded Drill-Down
fields.Description: Tests Skip's ability to create D3-based treemap visualizations with hierarchical data, color scales, and progressive drill-down through multiple detail levels.

InputDefinition.userMessage: Create a treemap visualization showing our revenue breakdown by membership type. Each rectangle should be sized by total revenue amount, and colored by growth rate compared to last year (use a gradient from red for negative growth to green for positive growth). When I click on any membership type rectangle, I want to see a horizontal bar chart showing the top 10 members in that type ranked by their individual revenue contribution. Then, when I click on any member's bar, show me a detailed breakdown table listing all their transactions (memberships, event registrations, course enrollments) with dates, amounts, and transaction types. Make sure each row in that transaction table is clickable so I can open the actual record. Include a breadcrumb or back button so I can navigate back up through the levels. The treemap should show both the membership type name and the total revenue amount in each rectangle.

judgeValidationCriteria: Response includes treemap with rectangles sized by revenue
Color gradient applied based on growth rate (red to green spectrum)
Each rectangle clearly labeled with membership type and revenue amount
Clicking rectangle drills down to horizontal bar chart of top 10 members
Bar chart shows member names and individual revenue contributions
Clicking member bar shows transaction detail table
Transaction table includes dates, amounts, types (membership/event/course)
Table rows support OpenEntityRecord for invoice/membership/registration records
Navigation includes breadcrumb or back functionality
Three levels of drill-down work smoothly with context maintained
